title: Jason Zuback
text:
Jason Zuback (born April 24, 1970), is a Canadian <a href="golf">golf</a>er who competed as a professional <a href="long%20drive">long drive</a> athlete. Nicknamed "Golfzilla", he won the <a href="World%20Long%20Drive%20Championship">World Long Drive Championship</a> on five occasions, in 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999 and 2006. He was inducted into the Long Drivers of America hall of fame in 2003.
Personal life.
Zuback was raised in <a href="Lethbridge">Lethbridge</a>, <a href="Alberta">Alberta</a>. He attended the <a href="University%20of%20Alberta">University of Alberta</a> in <a href="Edmonton">Edmonton</a>, where he graduated with a degree in <a href="pharmacy">pharmacy</a>. He worked as a pharmacist before embarking on a full-time career in long drive.
Long drive career.
Zuback first entered a long drive competition in 1995 after being given the idea by playing partners while attempting to qualify for the <a href="Alberta%20Open">Alberta Open</a>. He won his first event by 50 yards. The following year, he won the <a href="World%20Long%20Drive%20Championship">World Long Drive Championship</a> at his first attempt, and returned to defend the title for three more years. He won his fifth and final world title in 2006. He returned to win the "Masters" event, for over-45s, in 2015.
